post.html:
It has been a while since I started writing code it has been not that long actually since I realised how slow and unprodu tive I can be in comparison to my colleagues. Im not saying that I am bad at code or the fact that I am just generally slow (This is imposter syndrome territory, I hope). All I am saying that some of the tasks that I was doing took way too much time and when just a manual task of disabling the .env file, running the tests and renabling the file was way too cumbersome for my liking.

These are few tips, that I have found from my colleagues at work, online and tutorials that I followed along the way, to make myself a slightly faster. The things below did not help me solve the issues I have encountered, but just merely dealt with the simple and annoying tasks of everyday.

Alias everything

Create alerts for long tasks

Automate Everything

Write recipes for your IDE

Bookmark your goto documentation

Clean up your workspaces

frontmatter.title: Things that helped me to speed up my coding
frontmatter.author: Grace Zarczynska
